title: Graves uses quickdraw once

replies.body:
Olaf's ult is a trade-off to provide some counter-play.

If Olaf was tanky, high damage, fast-moving, self-sustaining and could not be disabled... what would be the counter-play? by removing his bonus defenses, he is made at least somewhat vulnerable to focus fire in exchange for being a rampaging unstoppable force.
You are correct about Olaf's counter-play. So here's the underlying point to my post. What is Graves' counter play? Gap closer? helll I think he'd prefer it if you are on top of him

> [{quoted}](name=Dominick Destine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ols3H8o9,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-11-19T00:43:03.106+0000)

> Olaf's ult is a trade-off to provide some counter-play.

> If Olaf was tanky, high damage, fast-moving, self-sustaining and could not be disabled... what would be the counter-play? by removing his bonus defenses, he is made at least somewhat vulnerable to focus fire in exchange for being a rampaging unstoppable force.

Graves is all of those things except the last right now
They need to tone down the amount of damage his bullets do and actually nerf the ratios on his Q.
Graves is stupidly overpowered right now, nothing 5 movement speed, 50 damage shaved off of Q and Mana cost nerfs to said Q will fix
